item.title: A Recluse
item.description: I'm spending a little time each day to read some traditional Chinese literature. Recently I've been interested in a book that can be dated to the early Zhou dynasty. I Ching was believed (by some) to be written by King Wen of Zhou when he was a prisoner at Youli, apparently before 1000 BC. If it is true, this is currently the oldest book that I've ever read. What I'd like to share today is some comment on the first stacked line of the hexagram qian (䷀) from Confucius.

item.title: Org Testing
item.description: First level Second level Third level Fourth level Markup Mary has a little lamb, little lamb, little lamb, little lamb, not-big lamb. Verses don't work Great clouds overhead Tiny black birds rise and fall Snow covers Emacs —AlexSchroeder Quotes work Everything should be made as simple as possible, but not any simpler —Albert Einstein Centering works Everything should be made as simple as possible, but not any simpler Verbatim verbatim
